Rule: Attaining a Doctorate degree can significantly increase the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Working more hours per week (specifically around 59 to 82 hours) can significantly increase the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Being male may increase the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Race may have an impact on the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year, although this might reflect societal or systemic biases.
Being self-employed can significantly increase the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year even with the same level of education and working hours.
Being married, even with the same education level (Some-college), leads to higher income.
Occupations such as Professional and Blue-Collar, combined with higher education (Doctorate), lead to higher income.
Working significantly fewer hours (e.g., 10 hours per week) or significantly more hours (e.g., 55 hours per week) can increase the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
While working in sales can be associated with earning more than $50k a year, transitioning to a white-collar occupation can also increase the likelihood of higher earnings.
